name: Chase Park Plaza

reviews.text: My husband is a St. Louis native who remembers fondly going to pro wrestling matches at the Chase Park Plaze when he was in high school. He's often mentioned the possibility of staying at the Chase some day. When we decided to drive to St. Louis to the History Museum in Forest Park, it seemed like just the time to do so - right across the street from the park and part of the Central West End scene. Although we did eat out for lunch at Balaban's (5 mins away), we spent the rest of our time in the hotel. Their cinema had 5 first-run movies playing - and the matinee price was quite reasonable. The hotel has 5 restaurants and 3 bars - and in the cold weather, the hotel becomes a nest. You don't have to go out for anything. We had a lovely gourmet meal and listened to jazz for free in the lobby bar. The service was prompt and friendly. and the room was immaculate. Galleria shopping is 10 mins away by car. Altogether a wonderful experience. My husband now wants to stay there everytime we go to Forest Park. He's an experienced business traveler and he was most impressed with the hotel. So was I.
reviews.title: Location, location, location
not worth the money
reviews.text: Chase park plaza was a huge disappointment. The hotel lobbies, restaurants and the movie theater are wonderful, but the rooms are completely different story. We got a discount rate room (~ 200$/per night) which put us next door to an elevator shaft. This combined with the noisy AC made sleeping without the earplugs impossible! On top of that we had 3 false fire alarms in two nights,complete with strobe lights in the room, and the 4th one during breakfast. Room was tiny and nothing special.

reviews.title: disappointed in the chase park plaza!
reviews.text: Stay at the Best Western just down the street for a fraction of the cost, and spend you money on a nice dinner instead.

reviews.title: A Terrible Experience
reviews.text: Chase Park Plaza is all front no substance.

reviews.title: Great deal/posh hotel!
reviews.text: we were in st louis for the first time in october 2005. we stayed at the chase park plaza for 2 nights and were very disappointed. the first room assigned to us had a terrible odor. we asked to be moved and were told that the cleaning staff could spray something to make it smell better. that didn't sound like an option for us, so we changed room. the 2nd room was better. both rooms were small and cramped. both bathrooms were outdated and the grout around the tubs was stained and dirty. don't be fooled by the outside appearance or pictures of the lobby, restaurants, pool etc. the rooms are less than average and the staff (for the most part) was unfriendly.

reviews.title: A wonderful experience at a fantastic luxury hotel.
reviews.text: My husband, infant son and I stayed at the Chase Park Plaza Hotel from May May 12- May 15, 2006. If you are ever in the St. Louis, Missouri area and are looking for a hotel in a chic, happening part of town; a hotel that is within minutes of the St. Louis Zoo, the St. Louis Children's Museum, a city park with an 18-hole golf course and 6.2 mile jogging/bike course, then you will definitely want to stay at the Chase Park Plaza Hotel. We absolutely loved our beautifully furnished room and the professional, responsive hotel staff. The hotel has various eating establishments and a movie theater. There are also a number of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The price of the rooms are worth every penny. We had a truly wonderful experience and we would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: I didn't even have to stay there for a bad experience!
reviews.text: I attempted to reserve some hotel rooms at the Chase for wedding guests in April 2006. The first person I talked to said ok, 4 rooms, give me your credit card number, no contract needed, you're rate is $159/night. When guests called to reserve rooms they were told we had no rooms reserved, the Chase had never heard of us, and the rate was now $289.

reviews.title: Tried out the romance package
reviews.text: I finally dealt with someone who had a clue and she was able to reserve 10 rooms for us at our original rate. When guests now called they were told the rooms reserved for us were available with one king bed and this was their only option. Consequently all of our guests stayed in other hotels.

I finally returned from my honeymoon to find a $182 charge to my credit card as if I stayed there! I never even set foot in the door. I did not have a single guest stay there. No one has called me back regarding this.
reviews.title: Valentines Day
There may be some nice rooms, but I didn't get one.
reviews.text: I can't tell you if the rooms were nice or the food was good, but if you'd like a headache the Chase is for you! I have never seen so many incompetent people in one place.

reviews.title: Five Plus
reviews.text: Just a great hotel. Staff and facilities are the best. Five Plus without a doubt. At least this time.

reviews.title: Communication lacking at this hotel
reviews.text: I live one block away from the Chase Park Plaza, so when my electricity went out at 10:00pm last Friday night, I decided I would take my husband whose birthday was the next day, and fourteen-year-old son to the Chase for the night.

reviews.title: Good time in Chase
reviews.text: I called for reservations and got a recording that told me the reservations desk was busy and switched me to another line where a young man answered to take my reservations. I told him I wanted to come in that evening and would depart the next morning. He asked how many adults and I told him two adults and one child. He asked how old my child was and I told him fourteen.

reviews.title: Best rooms ever!!!!!
reviews.text: He said he had a one bedroom suite available at a rate of $220 for the night. I suggested that since it was already at this point almost 10:15 and that the room had yet to be reserved for the night that maybe he could give me a better deal than the rack rate. He told me I could have the room for $165. He then confirmed my reservations--arriving on Saturday and departing on Sunday. I told him, "No. I asked for a room for this evening." He said, "Oh, well we don't have any rooms tonight." He then hung up without giving me any kind of confirmation of my cancellation. I called back to the hotel and got the front desk. A very nice young woman assured me she would cancel my reservation and said that yes they did have a room for the night. I told her we would be right there.

reviews.title: We will be back for sure!!
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel around 10:45 and the three of us checked in. We got to the room and my son order room service which came exactly as they said it would--20 minutes and piping hot. We laid in bed and read for a while and around 11:30 my son decided to go to bed. His father pulled one of the cushions off the couch, glanced at what he thought was the pullout part of the bed and realized there were no sheets and we couldn't find any extra pillows anywhere in our luxury suite. My husband called room service immediately and was told housekeeping would bring the sheets up right away. At 12:15 the sheets had still not arrived. Another call. More assurances the sheets would be up right away. At 12:30 and still no sheets my husband called again and was told by the night manager, "I can't babysit housekeeping." Then he again assured my husband the sheets would be coming. When they finally arrived at 12:45 it was then that we realized the couch was not a sofa sleeper but a short couch that my son was going to have to sleep on. Both the front desk and reservations had failed to tell us that this luxury suite only had one bed and no place for my son. I'm not sure where they thought he would sleep. He's 5' 9" tall. So he slept on this small sofa with his knees bent all night.

reviews.title: The Skinny on the Chase Park Plaza
reviews.text: The skinny on the Chase. This hotel may be the best hotel in St. Louis, but it comes at a price and with an ego. The biggest fans of the Chase are the people who work there and they forget sometimes that the Ritz is only five minutes away. That said, when I visit St. Louis I always stay at the Chase because I prefer to stay in the Central West End over Clayton. Here are some tips to make your stay more comfortable and affordable. If you are driving be prepared for a $20 a day valet fee.

aka: Chase Park Plaza Hotel Saint Louis
description: You’ve arrived at The Chase Park Plaza hotel, a vibrant legend accommodating guests in grand style, here in the heart of St. Louis. This stately landmark is home to a celebrated history. Through a recent renovation, that storied past has been lovingly preserved and artfully revitalized, with improvements ranging from décor updates to a five-screen cinema. More than one million square feet of luxurious accommodations await you, including:Impeccable guest suites Five fabulous restaurants Expansive event and meeting facilities Five-screen cinema Outdoor heated pool First-class spa and fitness facilities The Private Residences In addition to premier amenities, The Chase Park Plaza offers you a premier location surrounded by the very best St. Louis has to offer. On your doorstep is the Central West End, one of the city’s most popular dining and entertainment areas. Just across the street you’ll find Forest Park, home to fine museums, a world-renowned zoo and one of the country’s finest public golf courses. As our guest, you’re also just moments away from the Barnes-Jewish Hospital complex, Busch Stadium, Washington University, St. Louis University, the downtown and Clayton business districts and Lambert International Airport.At The Chase Park Plaza you’ll feel truly welcome. In so many ways.
